com.googlecode.aluminumproject.servlet

Class AluminumServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.servlet.AluminumServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public class AluminumServlet
extends HttpServlet
    A servlet that uses Aluminum to serve web content.

    Upon initialisation, a new template engine is being created. Both its configuration and the configuration parameters can be configured by overriding the createConfiguration and createConfigurationParameters methods. The default implementation creates a default configuration that uses context and init parameters as configuration parameters.

    The template engine is reused for each request. The name of the template that will be executed is equal to (depending on how the servlet is mapped in the deployment descriptor) either the servlet path or the path info, exluding the leading slash. This means that when the Aluminum servlet is added to a local application that's deployed under context path /app and mapped to /aluminum/*, a request to http://localhost/app/aluminum/hello.xml will result in the template name hello.xml.

    The name of the parser that will be used is gotten by looking at the extension of the template name. So in the previous example, the template would be parsed with the xml parser. To change this process, override the determineParser method.

    Templates operate in a context that's designed for a servlet environment: the servlet context. It gives access to the application and the request and response objects, and provides a couple of extra scopes. The createContext method can be overridden if another context is desired.

    The writer that is used by the template engine is the response writer, that writes byte arrays (for binary output) or strings (for textual output) to the servlet output stream. When a different writer is needed, the createWriter method can be overridden by subclasses.

    See Also:

      • determineParser

        protected String determineParser(String name)
                          throws AluminumException
        Determines the name of the parser that should be used for a certain request. This implementation returns the extension of the template path.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the template that will be processed
        Returns:
        the name of the parser that should be used when processing the template
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the parser can't be determined

      • createContext

        protected Context createContext()
                         throws AluminumException
        Creates the context that will be used when processing a template. Each request, a new context will be created. This implementation will return a new servlet context.
        Returns:
        the context to use
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the context can't be created

        protected Writer createWriter()

        the writer to use
